author: parithosh
content: I think besu might? Do you have a branch for me? If so I can try out a local devnet and share a config

author: siladu
content: Have been chatting to Lucas today, hoping I can share something soon

author: siladu
content:
Made some progress: got through pectra with `teku:develop` and this Besu branch https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/8044 but pretty soon after got some invalid blocks. 
After catching up with <@905058765022310460> there's still a few small outstanding code changes before we're fully ready for devnet-5 so we'll continue with local testing for now.

author: parithosh
content:
Please note that the system contracts address changes for devnet-5:
`EIP-7002`: `0x0c15F14308530b7CDB8460094BbB9cC28b9AaaAA`
`EIP-7251`: `0x00431F263cE400f4455c2dCf564e53007Ca4bbBb`
`EIP-2935`: `0x0F792be4B0c0cb4DAE440Ef133E90C0eCD48CCCC` (Open PR: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9144)
We're merging in this breaking PR to our genesis tools, so kurtosis and everything else will target devnet-5 specs and would not work for devnet-4 images. 
https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-genesis-generator/pull/162
https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-genesis-generator/pull/168

author: .fjl
content: Not sure where to raise this, but can we again go over the benefits of revert instead of returning zero in the blockhash contract

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content:
<@508125616940515329> I was testing Teku with ethereumjs (devnet-5 branch) and I notice ethereumjs is still including emtpy requests on the Engine API requests. here is an example:
```
2024-12-19 11:19:08 INFO[2024-12-18T22:19:08Z] RESPONSE #121: POST /                         length=1490 status=200 type=json
2024-12-19 11:19:08 {
[...]
2024-12-19 11:19:08     "executionRequests": [
2024-12-19 11:19:08       "0x",
2024-12-19 11:19:08       "0x",
2024-12-19 11:19:08       "0x"
2024-12-19 11:19:08     ],
[...]2024-12-19 11:19:08 }
```
I am not sure if you guys are ready for devnet-5 yet but I thought I'd let you know ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: Thanks! I will check our engine API, we *should* report the requestsHash correctly but our engine API might be wrong (actually I don't think I fixed it, will check ðŸ™‚ )
